com.nathanlea

Class MemorySimulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nathanlea.MemorySimulation

  • public class MemorySimulation
extends java.lang.Object

    The class is a memory simulation to test and compare first fit/best fit/worst fit memory placement strategies

    Developed by Nathan Lea on 2/8/2016 - 3/8/2016 for CS4303 Operating Systems

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentJob
      The current PID of the job that the simulation is working on
      private int idleTime
      Counter to track the number of VTU's that the CPU has nothing to do
      private int jobsInRange
      Count of the number of jobs completed between 1000 and 4000
      private int[] memory
      The main memory array for all of the jobs to go into
      private int method
      method 0 - First Fit 1 - Best Fit - Current Best Hole 2 - Worst Fit - Current Worst Hole 3 - Best Best Fit - Best Hole Ever 4 - Worst Worst Fit - Worst Hole Ever
      private int nextJobPID
      Describes what the next id for the job will be, used to keep track of the many jobs going through the simulation this is used in the same way as a linux system where the PIDs increase by ever job
      private boolean notRejected
      used to in the memory placement to tell whether the placement rejected the job
      private double processingTime
      Track data about completed jobs
      private java.util.Random r
      The Random Object used as the random number generator for the system
      private java.util.Queue<java.lang.Integer> readyQueue
      Ready Queue to track jobs that have been inserted into memory and are waiting to be completed by the CPU
      private java.util.Queue<java.lang.Integer> rejectedJobs
      The queue of the rejected jobs that were to big to fit into memory
      private int startingPID 
      private double turnAroundTime
      Track data about completed jobs
      private double waitingTime
      Track data about completed jobs

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private float averageHoleSize()
      Loops through all of memory and averages the current holes
      private boolean CPU(int VTU)
      Method to simulation a CPU completed work on a task and calling the memoryManager(int[], boolean) to remove the job from memory
      private boolean departure(int PID)
      Frees memory block occupied with the given PID
      private void endingOutput()
      Output data about the simulation that just finished Completed Jobs Waiting Jobs Rejected Jobs Turnaround Time Waiting Time Processing Time Idle Time
      private int getDurationOfJob(int PID)
      Searches through memory and finds the memory block with the given PID and return the duration of the job
      private int getJobTime(int PID)
      Searches through memory and finds the memory block with the given PID and return the duration of the job
      private int getNextJobArrival()
      Used to get a random number to add to the VTU, to get the next job arrival
      int[] initializer(int nextJobPID, int VTU)
      Calls the Random to generate the size, duration of the new job to the system
      private void memoryDump()
      Prints a memory dump of the memory array Used for debug purposes
      private boolean memoryManager(int[] job, boolean place)
      Places or removes a job into memory If placing looks at method and calls the proper placement algorithm If removed calls the dispatched to free memory block
      private void outputAt100(int VTU)
      Outputs VTU Completed Jobs Rejects Jobs Average Hole Total Fragmented Bytes Storage Utilization
      private void outputAt1000()
      Outputs the number of current Rejected jobs
      private boolean placeBestFit(int PID, int size, int duration, int genTime)
      The memory strategy that find the best current hole and places the job in that hole that creates the smallest left over hole If method == 3 then this method is also used for best best fit, which places a job in the best possible hole that will ever be.
      private boolean placeFirstFit(int PID, int size, int duration, int genTime)
      The memory placement algorithm that find the first hole and places the job in the first hole big enough to hold the job
      private boolean placeWorstFit(int PID, int size, int duration, int genTime)
      The memory strategy that find the worst current hole and places the job in that hole that creates the largest left over hole If method == 4 then this method is also used for worst worst fit, which places a job in the worst possible hole that will ever be.
      void start()
      Starts the simulation of Memory
      private float storageUtilization()
      Calculates the total used memory and dives that by the total memory
      private float totalFragmentBytes()
      Loops through all of memory and adds the holes less than 5 blocks

      • startingPID

        private final int startingPID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • memory

        private int[] memory
        The main memory array for all of the jobs to go into

      • nextJobPID

        private int nextJobPID
        Describes what the next id for the job will be, used to keep track of the many jobs going through the simulation this is used in the same way as a linux system where the PIDs increase by ever job

      • r

        private java.util.Random r
        The Random Object used as the random number generator for the system

      • method

        private int method
        method 0 - First Fit 1 - Best Fit - Current Best Hole 2 - Worst Fit - Current Worst Hole 3 - Best Best Fit - Best Hole Ever 4 - Worst Worst Fit - Worst Hole Ever

      • notRejected

        private boolean notRejected
        used to in the memory placement to tell whether the placement rejected the job

      • jobsInRange

        private int jobsInRange
        Count of the number of jobs completed between 1000 and 4000

        private double turnAroundTime
        Track data about completed jobs

      • waitingTime

        private double waitingTime
        Track data about completed jobs

      • processingTime

        private double processingTime
        Track data about completed jobs

      • idleTime

        private int idleTime
        Counter to track the number of VTU's that the CPU has nothing to do

      • readyQueue

        private java.util.Queue<java.lang.Integer> readyQueue
        Ready Queue to track jobs that have been inserted into memory and are waiting to be completed by the CPU

        The current PID of the job that the simulation is working on

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the simulation of Memory

      • getNextJobArrival

        private int getNextJobArrival()
        Used to get a random number to add to the VTU, to get the next job arrival
        Returns:
        Random number 0-10
        See Also:
        Random

      • CPU

        private boolean CPU(int VTU)
        Method to simulation a CPU completed work on a task and calling the memoryManager(int[], boolean) to remove the job from memory
        Parameters:
        VTU - Current Virtual Time Unit of the simulation
        Returns:
        Success of removing the current job from memory

      • initializer

        public int[] initializer(int nextJobPID,
                         int VTU)
        Calls the Random to generate the size, duration of the new job to the system
        Parameters:
        nextJobPID - the next pid to set to the generated job
        VTU - Current Virtual Time Unit of the simulation
        Returns:
        An int array with the information about a job

      • memoryManager

        private boolean memoryManager(int[] job,
                              boolean place)
        Places or removes a job into memory If placing looks at method and calls the proper placement algorithm If removed calls the dispatched to free memory block
        Parameters:
        job - The array of information about the job to be placed or removed in memory
        place - True is placing a job in memory, False if removing job from memory
        Returns:
        success of the function, either placing or removing
        See Also:
        placeFirstFit(int, int, int, int), placeBestFit(int, int, int, int), placeWorstFit(int, int, int, int), departure(int)

      • placeFirstFit

        private boolean placeFirstFit(int PID,
                              int size,
                              int duration,
                              int genTime)
        The memory placement algorithm that find the first hole and places the job in the first hole big enough to hold the job
        Parameters:
        PID - The Job Identifier
        size - The size of the Job
        duration - The duration that the job takes to complete
        genTime - What time did the job get put in memory
        Returns:
        True, if job was placed False, if job either was not placed. The global notRejected tells the program if the job was reject or not

      • placeBestFit

        private boolean placeBestFit(int PID,
                             int size,
                             int duration,
                             int genTime)
        The memory strategy that find the best current hole and places the job in that hole that creates the smallest left over hole If method == 3 then this method is also used for best best fit, which places a job in the best possible hole that will ever be. This is used to expand on and see best fit blow up to create a bigger difference
        Parameters:
        PID - The Job Identifier
        size - The size of the Job
        duration - The duration that the job takes to complete
        genTime - What time did the job get put in memory
        Returns:
        True, if job was placed False, if job either was not placed. The global notRejected tells the program if the job was reject or not

      • placeWorstFit

        private boolean placeWorstFit(int PID,
                              int size,
                              int duration,
                              int genTime)
        The memory strategy that find the worst current hole and places the job in that hole that creates the largest left over hole If method == 4 then this method is also used for worst worst fit, which places a job in the worst possible hole that will ever be. This is used to expand on and see worst fit blow up to create a bigger difference
        Parameters:
        PID - The Job Identifier
        size - The size of the Job
        duration - The duration that the job takes to complete
        genTime - What time did the job get put in memory
        Returns:
        True, if job was placed False, if job either was not placed. The global notRejected tells the program if the job was reject or not

      • departure

        private boolean departure(int PID)
        Frees memory block occupied with the given PID
        Parameters:
        PID - The PID of the job looking to be freed from memory
        Returns:
        True if memory freeing was successful, False if job was not found in memory

      • getDurationOfJob

        private int getDurationOfJob(int PID)
        Searches through memory and finds the memory block with the given PID and return the duration of the job
        Parameters:
        PID - PID of job to find the duration of
        Returns:
        the duration of the job with the given PID

      • getJobTime

        private int getJobTime(int PID)
        Searches through memory and finds the memory block with the given PID and return the duration of the job
        Parameters:
        PID - PID of job to find the time of
        Returns:
        the time of the job with the given PID

      • averageHoleSize

        private float averageHoleSize()
        Loops through all of memory and averages the current holes
        Returns:
        the Average Size of the Holes in memory

      • totalFragmentBytes

        private float totalFragmentBytes()
        Loops through all of memory and adds the holes less than 5 blocks
        Returns:
        The number of blocks in hole less than 5, unusable memory

      • storageUtilization

        private float storageUtilization()
        Calculates the total used memory and dives that by the total memory
        Returns:
        Used memory / total Memory

      • endingOutput

        private void endingOutput()
        Output data about the simulation that just finished
        • Completed Jobs
        • Waiting Jobs
        • Rejected Jobs
        • Turnaround Time
        • Waiting Time
        • Processing Time
        • Idle Time

      • outputAt100

        private void outputAt100(int VTU)
        Outputs
        • VTU
        • Completed Jobs
        • Rejects Jobs
        • Average Hole
        • Total Fragmented Bytes
        • Storage Utilization
        Parameters:
        VTU - Current Virtual Time Unit of the simulation

      • outputAt1000

        private void outputAt1000()
        Outputs the number of current Rejected jobs

      • memoryDump

        private void memoryDump()
        Prints a memory dump of the memory array Used for debug purposes
